abstract: Republican politicians like Texas Gov Greg Abbott have increasingly been passing laws at state level to block or overturn regulations enacted by cities; state conservatives, enraged over town of Denton's ban on fracking, have countered with range of bills to stymie local power; Republican state lawmakers in multiple states are passing so-called pre-emption laws to obstruct actions of voters and leaders in large municipalities, which tend to be more liberal.
lead_paragraph: So-called pre-emption laws, passed in states across the country, have stopped cities from regulating landlords, building municipal broadband systems and raising the minimum wage.

headline.main: States Are Blocking Local Regulations, Often at Industry’s Behest
headline.print_headline: States Are Blocking Local Regulations, Often at Industry’s Behest

snippet: So-called pre-emption laws, passed in states across the country, have stopped cities from regulating landlords, building municipal broadband systems and raising the minimum wage.
